channel.title: Who invented RSPS?
channel.description: I was wondering who invented RuneScape Private servers and who started the first RSPS. And like how did he get his hands on the source of RuneScape. Just being curious :D Oh and also when did this happen? Try to answer as many questions as possible, thank you.

item.title: Who invented RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“killer90210, post:12, topic:328516”]sigh as i said it could have bin LEAKED not stolen damn infadel[/quote]Nothing was leaked, idiot. wL reverse engineered the runescape client and created a server emulation based on the client’s awaited packet responses.

Just look at it this way, from a more simplified view; suppose the client would run the following login function:

public void login() { ..writeByte(14); if (..readByte() != 1) { return; } }From this block of code you can infer that if the server writes anything but ‘1’ in response to the login opcode, it is refusing a new connection from initializing. Obviously it was much more complex than this, but the concept remains the same for any game.

Read full topic

item.title: Who invented RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

Umm, if it were leaked, it would’ve been way better than that shit winterlove made.

No server out, aside from 317Serv, Hyperion, and rs2v (From what I have seen) are actually made good and stable.

Read full topic

He didn’t steal the source, only the cache. He just entirely recreated runescape.

@killer90210 wrote:

i hate to say no one knows for sure some claim it to be jagex to test updates and it got leaked others claim it to be winter and some even claim it to be mopar

Read full topic

item.title: Who invented RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“Owned_Pl0xs, post:5, topic:328516”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=424901.msg3120499#msg3120499 date=1265489466]

I think it was winterlove, I’m not sure.
[/quote]and who is winterlove??

WinterLove was the first Private-Server created, public one. The guy’s name was winterlove too, lol.
The original reason for the server was to test how bots would work on it so then they could use the bot for real Runescape.

Here is a tree that I saw Graham post of how servers came out in the order:

Btw - This tree might misguide you, keep in note that pimpscape is not one of the latest releases, it was one of the old ones, and emulous is a new release, not an old one.

More on the history from blakeman8192:

[quote]late 2005/early 2006: kaitnieks was an active and thriving cheating community for runescape
same era: wL made his first server in order to test bots and learn about the protocol. it was single player and horribly coded
early 2006: daiki takes wL’s source and makes it multiplayer, still a “proof of concept” with maybe a bit of support/interest for actually playing it, releases it under the name “blakescape d boosted”
same era: kaitnieks shuts down
soon after: mitb forms for the refugees of the death of kaitnieks, runescape cheating becomes centralized once more
soon after that: development continues by random individuals on the opensource blakescape server and interest increases in hosting/playing servers
soon after that (mid-2006): mitb separates itself from private servers by creating mscp
late 2006: google comes out
2007: mscp is booming with thousands of people
2007+: mscp/mitb are slowly dying (still) as cheating and emulation become decentralized, while content development is made by hundreds of amateur programmers

some history of significant server releases (in chronological order):
winterlove (first release)
blakescape (multiplayer)
mythscape (some early content)
cheezscape (combat, npcs, etc)
whitescape (improved content)
p16 (even more improved content)
rs2dv (entire new release)
hyperion (first commercial scale performance release)
[/quote][/quote]

That’s a great flow chart, thanks for posting it, rep++.

Read full topic

[/quote]and who is winterlove??[/quote]

WinterLove was the first Private-Server created, public one. The guy’s name was winterlove too, lol.
The original reason for the server was to test how bots would work on it so then they could use the bot for real Runescape.

Here is a tree that I saw Graham post of how servers came out in the order:

Btw - This tree might misguide you, keep in note that pimpscape is not one of the latest releases, it was one of the old ones, and emulous is a new release, not an old one.

More on the history from blakeman8192:

late 2005/early 2006: kaitnieks was an active and thriving cheating community for runescape same era: wL made his first server in order to test bots and learn about the protocol. it was single player and horribly coded early 2006: daiki takes wL's source and makes it multiplayer, still a "proof of concept" with maybe a bit of support/interest for actually playing it, releases it under the name "blakescape d boosted" same era: kaitnieks shuts down soon after: mitb forms for the refugees of the death of kaitnieks, runescape cheating becomes centralized once more soon after that: development continues by random individuals on the opensource blakescape server and interest increases in hosting/playing servers soon after that (mid-2006): mitb separates itself from private servers by creating mscp late 2006: rune-server comes out 2007: mscp is booming with thousands of people 2007+: mscp/mitb are slowly dying (still) as cheating and emulation become decentralized, while content development is made by hundreds of amateur programmers

some history of significant server releases (in chronological order):
winterlove (first release)
blakescape (multiplayer)
mythscape (some early content)
cheezscape (combat, npcs, etc)
whitescape (improved content)
p16 (even more improved content)
